title: Nobody here has any idea what balance is
body:
And they are all delusional thinking Riot even listens to them

You think Riot takes any of these considerations? Hahahahaha

replies.body: League of legends is by far the most balanced competitive team based PvP game in existence. If you honestly think they would be giving the cash awards they do for professional tournaments on something that's unfair then you are dumb as a box of rocks.

WoW holds Arena tournaments with cash prizes, and its PvP usually regarded as "imbalanced" by the community, so I dunno what to tell you if you think throwing cash at people who will play somehow means it's balanced. Not saying League is particularly horrible at the moment or anything, but I'd be lying if I said it was the most balanced right now.

> Then DotA2 is equally balanced, yes?

Never played it so I have no idea.

After having played it myself, and so can compare DotA and League: DotA is better balanced. The balance takes place differently, but far more heroes are viable both competitively and in pub game situations than there are in League, at high levels and low levels of play both. In addition, more strategies are also viable in DotA2 than there are in League, and the meta is far less concrete and stagnant than the one currently taking place in League, that has been for years now. As far as I'm aware, as of the Qualifiers for TI5, there are only 5 unpicked heroes. Five. 

Death Prophet, Elder Titan, Necrophos, Terrorblade, and Wraith King. 

How long has it been since League saw that level of diversity at a competitive level? That said, League has become better about it, so there is hope, and I do hope for the best for League.

I sure as hell hope Riot doesn't listen to these boards.

The amount of people who think dumb shit like that LeBlanc still needs nerfs or that Riven is the most overpowered champion in the game is absurd.

If Board feedback is to be believed then half the champions in the game can't be balanced due to the very nature of their kit/playstyle, and Riven, in addition to half the assassin roster, are the most broken creations in the history of gaming. 

Luckily, I'm glad that it seems like Riot simply reads the feedback on the boards, but doesn't necessarily implement it. They give notification that they read through patch note messages that refer to board posts, but the board posts aren't why the change transpired in the first place.

But Riot looks at these forums and occasionally someone suggests something worthwhile.

That they never bother with. It took somebody being in Riot Games to go say "Hey, Nocturne should probably automatically target the guy he ults for basic attacks."

The only sort of fan suggestion I've seen Riot take and then implement seems to be skin ideas. It's almost like Valve's Steam Workshop implementation for DotA2, but much less immediate. If it was, we'd already have Dragon Master Swain, and would have had Void Fizz at least a year earlier.

Balance suggestions are fairly numerous, so it is kinda difficult to say how many of them could have taken cues from the forum population and which ones weren't, especially nerfs for fotm champions since when you combine the forum populace, you have every single aspect of their kit being requested nerfs so someone will always be able to say that Riot used theirs. I do, however, find it telling when a community can't come to a decent idea about which ability of any fotm champion is broken, so over time you see, well, all of them. Lee Sin being the best example, as literally every single part of his kit was requested nerfs by the community when the Lee Hate Train (it had some cars following along labeled "Vi" and "Jarvan IV", too) was strong on the rails. In response, Riot proceeded to not nerf anything directly to Lee Sin to my knowledge, maybe Warrior enchant aside, and buff tanks. Now the Lee outcry has passed, without Riot doing a thing about him directly.

"Make Riven's CD start after 3rd cast of Q, without compensation."

Yep. Brainless mouth-breathing glue-eaters are also allow to post, apparently.

How people like this turn their computer on is beyond me.
